  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()

  • Method Details

    • registerBook

      public String registerBook(int pagesAmount, String name, String publishDate, String url, String review, int genreFlag, double sellPrice)
      The function registers a book with given parameters and adds it to a list of products.
      Parameters:
      pagesAmount - an integer representing the number of pages in the book
      name - The name of the book being registered.
      publishDate - The date when the book was published.
      url - The URL parameter is a string that represents the URL of the book's webpage or online store page.
      review - A string containing a review or description of the book.
      genreFlag - An integer value representing the genre of the book. 1 represents Science Fiction, 2 represents Fantasy, and 3 represents History Novel.
      sellPrice - The price at which the book will be sold.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message indicating that the book has been registered and providing its ID.

    • deleteBibliographicProduct

      public String deleteBibliographicProduct(String productId)
      This function deletes a bibliographic product from a list of products based on its ID and returns a message indicating whether the deletion was successful or not.
      Parameters:
      productId - a String representing the ID of the bibliographic product that needs to be deleted from a list of products.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message indicating whether the product was successfully deleted or not. If the product is found and deleted, the message will say "The product [product name] was deleted." If the product is not found, the message will say "Couldn't delete product."

    • modifyProductName

      public String modifyProductName(String productId, String newName)
      This function modifies the name of a product and returns a message indicating the original and new names.
      Parameters:
      productId - A String representing the unique identifier of a bibliographic product.
      newName - The new name that will replace the current name of the product.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message that indicates the original name of a product was changed to a new name. The message is in the format "The name: [original name] was changed to: [new name]".

    • modifyProductDate

      public String modifyProductDate(String productId, String newDate)
      This function modifies the publish date of a bibliographic product and returns a message indicating the change.
      Parameters:
      productId - a String representing the unique identifier of a bibliographic product.
      newDate - A string representing the new publish date that will replace the current publish date of a bibliographic product.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message that indicates the original publish date of a product has been changed to a new date. The message includes both the original date and the new date.

    • modifyProductPages

      public String modifyProductPages(String productId, int newPagesAmount)
      This function modifies the number of pages of a bibliographic product and returns a message indicating the change.
      Parameters:
      productId - a String representing the unique identifier of a bibliographic product.
      newPagesAmount - an integer representing the new amount of pages for a bibliographic product.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that informs the user that the amount of pages of a product has been changed from the original amount to a new amount.

    • modifyBookReview

      public String modifyBookReview(String productId, String newReview)
      This function modifies the review of a book in a list of products based on the book's ID.
      Parameters:
      productId - A String representing the ID of the book product whose review needs to be modified.
      newReview - The new review that will replace the existing review of the book.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message indicating whether the book review was successfully updated or not. If the book is found and updated, the message will be "The review has been updated". If the book is not found, the message will be an empty string.

    • modifyBookPrice

      public String modifyBookPrice(String productId, double newPrice)
      This function modifies the sell price of a book in a list of products based on the book's ID.
      Parameters:
      productId - a String representing the unique identifier of a bibliographic product (in this case, a book)
      newPrice - a double value representing the new price of a book
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message indicating whether the price of the book with the given productId has been updated or not.

    • modifyMagazineSubPrice

      public String modifyMagazineSubPrice(String productId, double newPrice)
      This function modifies the subscription price of a magazine product in a list of bibliographic products.
      Parameters:
      productId - a String representing the ID of a bibliographic product (in this case, a magazine)
      newPrice - a double value representing the new subscription price for a magazine product.
      Returns:
      The method returns a String message indicating whether the price of the magazine subscription has been updated or not.

    • modifyMagazineEmission

      public String modifyMagazineEmission(String productId, String newFrequency)
      The function modifies the emission frequency of a magazine product in a list of bibliographic products.
      Parameters:
      productId - a String representing the ID of the magazine product to be modified.
      newFrequency - A String representing the new emission frequency that will be set for a Magazine object.
      Returns:
      The method returns a String message indicating whether the magazine with the given productId was found and its emission frequency was updated or not.

    • modifyBookGenre

      public String modifyBookGenre(String productId, int genreFlag)
      The function modifies the genre of a book in a list of bibliographic products based on a given product ID and genre flag.
      Parameters:
      productId - A String representing the ID of the book product to be modified.
      genreFlag - An integer value representing the new genre to be assigned to a book.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message indicating whether the genre of a book has been updated or not.

    • modifyMagazineCategory

      public String modifyMagazineCategory(String productId, int categoryFlag)
      This function modifies the category of a magazine product based on a given category flag.
      Parameters:
      productId - A String representing the ID of the magazine product that needs to be modified.
      categoryFlag - An integer value representing the new category to be assigned to a magazine product. The possible values are 1, 2, or 3, which correspond to the categories VARIETIES, DESIGN, and SCIENCE, respectively.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message indicating whether the magazine category has been updated or not. The message is stored in the variable "msg".

    • getProduct

      public BibliographicProduct getProduct(String productId)
      This function searches for a BibliographicProduct object in a list of products by its ID and returns it.
      Parameters:
      productId - a String representing the ID of a bibliographic product that needs to be retrieved from a list of products. The method iterates through the list of products and returns the first product that matches the given ID. If no product is found, it returns null.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a BibliographicProduct object.

    • registerMagazine

      public String registerMagazine(int pagesAmount, String name, String publishDate, String url, double subscriptionPrice, int categoryFlag, String emissionFrequency)
      This function registers a new magazine with its properties and adds it to a list of products.
      Parameters:
      pagesAmount - The number of pages in the magazine.
      name - The name of the magazine being registered.
      publishDate - The date when the magazine was published.
      url - The URL parameter is a string that represents the web address or location of the magazine, where it can be accessed or downloaded from.
      subscriptionPrice - The price that a customer has to pay to subscribe to the magazine.
      categoryFlag - An integer value representing the category of the magazine being registered.
      emissionFrequency - The frequency at which the magazine is published, such as monthly, bi-monthly, quarterly, etc.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message indicating whether the magazine has been successfully registered or not.

    • registerUser

      public String registerUser(int flag, String name, String id, String linkDate)
      The function registers a user as either a regular or premium user and returns a message indicating whether the registration was successful or not.
      Parameters:
      flag - an integer value that determines whether the user being registered is a regular user (flag = 1) or a premium user (flag = 2).
      name - The name of the user being registered.
      id - The unique identifier for the user being registered.
      linkDate - It is a String variable that represents the date when the user's account was linked or created.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message indicating whether the user was successfully registered as a regular or premium user.

    • buyBibliographicProduct

      public String buyBibliographicProduct(String productName, String userId)
      The function allows a user to buy a bibliographic product (book or magazine) and returns a message indicating whether the purchase was successful or not.
      Parameters:
      productName - a String representing the name of the bibliographic product (book or magazine) that the user wants to buy.
      userId - The ID of the user who wants to buy the bibliographic product.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message indicating the result of the operation of buying a bibliographic product. The message can be "The book [productName] has been bought.", "You have subscribed to the magazine [productName]", or a message returned by the addBook or addMagazine method of the RegularUser class.

    • initSystem

      public String initSystem()
      The function initializes a system by creating and adding objects such as books, magazines, and users, and returns a message with their respective IDs.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that confirms the system has been charged and provides the IDs of the objects created for testing purposes.

    • sendTotalPagesForSimulation

      public int sendTotalPagesForSimulation(String productId)
      The function returns the total number of pages for a given product ID.
      Parameters:
      productId - A string representing the unique identifier of a bibliographic product.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value which represents the total number of pages of a bibliographic product identified by the given productId.

    • sendNameForSimulation

      public String sendNameForSimulation(String productId)
      This function retrieves the name of a product based on its ID and returns it as a string.
      Parameters:
      productId - A string representing the unique identifier of a product.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String variable named "productName", which contains the name of a product obtained from a BibliographicProduct object.
